title: Map the Intrinsic Muscle Groups
summary: Segment thenar, hypothenar, lumbricals, and interossei with origin/insertion mnemonics and quick innervation overlays.
high_yield: Reinforce LOAF innervation split (median vs. ulnar) while highlighting muscle bellies.
Show functional motions (opposition, abduction/adduction) to connect to clinical deficits.
Use color-coded groups to prep for intrinsic-minus hand pathology recognition.
pitfalls: Avoid overwhelming with too many attachment points—limit to proximal/distal summary boxes.
Differentiate dorsal vs. palmar interossei actions (DAB/PAD) explicitly.

animation_timeline.narration: Highlight thenar muscles sequentially (Abductor/APB, Flexor/FPB, Opponens) with LOAF callout.
animation_timeline.visual: Thumb mound color-coded; overlay 'Median nerve (recurrent branch)'.

animation_timeline.narration: Shift to hypothenar trio (ADM, FDM, ODM) plus palmaris brevis; tag ulnar nerve innervation.
animation_timeline.visual: Medial palm glow with ulnar nerve icon flowing through Guyon’s canal.

animation_timeline.narration: Overlay lumbricals and interossei with motion arrows (DAB/PAD) and note dual innervation for lumbricals 1–2.
animation_timeline.visual: Palmar view with arrows showing ab/adduct; text badges for median vs. deep ulnar.
